result.execSummary:
The defendant TINA L MCCANDLESS was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Remarks by Atty. Jansen.  Defendant makes a statement to the Court.  Court makes its findings and pronounces sentence.  Appeal rights given.

SENTENCE:4 years prison + 6 years extended supervision.  Credit for 294 days served.

records.addlTxt: Exhibit 1 - Toxicology  Report for DE
Arraignment on May 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:08 AM Defendant TINA L MCCANDLESS in court with attorney Bradley J Jansen.  Defendant TINA L MCCANDLESS in custody.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dep. Chase Mason sworn & testifies. Victim rights complied with.  Witness id's DE. Court corrects case #'s called.  Cross-exam. Objection - calls for speculation - sustained.  Det. Rich Wright sworn & testifies.  Ex 1 marked & id'd - State Crime Lab Toxicology Report for DE. Ex. offered, Atty Jansen argues relevance.  Court accepts exhibit.  Cross-exam.  Closing arguments.  Atty Jansen - moves for dismissal of Court 1.  Court finds probable cause, binds the matter over for trial.  DA requests 30 days to file information. 

10:57 AM  BOND MODIFICATION:
Atty Jansen - requesting bond be modified to $2500 cash bond & $47,500 signature bond, states arguments. DA Parker - objects to modification, believes same victim in 18CM316.  Atty Jansen - argues.   Court - believes bond set is appropriate - DENIES motion. 

  Arraignment scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
